results.title: The Western
results.creator_credit: Sasha Alpert, Lesley Karsten, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “American cinema”.
The Western is an American myth that has been translated by other cultures and re-interpreted time and time again but never dies. With film clips and critical commentary on Westerns, from John Ford’s “Stagecoach” to the work of Arthur Penn, Sam Peckinpah and Clint Eastwood, the program traces the aesthetic evolution of the genre as well as its sociological importance.

results.title: The Star
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Pitkethly, Danielle Gardner, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “American cinema”.
Greta Garbo, Cary Grant, Dustin Hoffman - these amongst many others are names synonymous with Hollywood. Early on, Hollywood saw that recognisable talent could minimise the financial risks of film production. Critics, film scholars and studio publicists view the stars from many angles, as marketing tools, cultural icons and products of the industry. Joan Crawford is used as a case study.

results.title: Classical Hollywood style
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Pitkethly, Molly Ornati, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “American cinema”.
In classical Hollywood film, the story is primary. Filmmakers rely on style, structure, narrative and visual elements to tell their story. Martin Scorcese and Sydney Pollack are among the directors who discuss their own style and how the classical Hollywood style, although evolving, endures and impacts on their work.

results.title: An Inquiry into the growth of American cities
results.creator_credit: Bert Kempers and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Altered Environment Series”.
American cities have grown outwards, due to the appearance of unlimited land resources. Now questions are being asked about the environmental destruction resulting from urban sprawl. This film involves students in an analysis of the factors that must be considered in the design of cities

group_siblings.title: An Enquiry into the American highway
group_siblings.creator_credit: Bert Kempers and BFA Educational Media

results.title: An Enquiry into the American highway
results.creator_credit: Bert Kempers and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Altered Environment Series”.
Points out that there is enough sealed road surface in the United States to cover most of the New England area. Questions what effects highways have on the total environment, what alternatives there are, and how to choose the best ways to use the land.

results.title: Measure of care: Alligator Rivers region
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
Following an environmental impact study by Mr Justice Fox, the Australian Government set up the Office of the Supervising Scientist to carry out scientific research in the Alligator River region of Kakadu National Park to establish base-line figures which would enable scientists to monitor the mining activities. This documentary deals in some detail with this research, and discusses the problems associated with mining in such an unusual and beautiful part of Kakadu National Park. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

group_siblings.title: Impact of mining
group_siblings.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia

results.title: Impact of mining
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
The second film in a series looking at the work of the Supervising Scientist following the Fox Report on Uranium mining in the Kakadu National Park region of the Northern Territory. To monitor possible problems, scientific studies were carried out before work began. Shows some of the field work and by the use of interviews examines possible problems which could occur.

results.title: Fear and Fantasy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “All in the Mind Series”.
A psychological study of anxiety and prejudice. Highlights how anxiety is the root source of many prejudices and how group training procedures can provide personal insight into problems.
